text: Nodir Naam Modhumoti (translated as The River Named Modhumoti) is a 1996 Bangladeshi Bengali language film directed by Tanvir Mokammel. It won 20th Bangladesh National Film Awards for the Best Story, Best Dialogue and Best Male Playback Singer. ==Background== The film was banned by the Censor Board in 1994 citing the reason "anti-nationalist". Mokammel appealed this ban to the Bangladesh Supreme Court, and then to the High Court. The film was released later in 1996. ==Cast== * Tauquir Ahmed * Aly Zaker * Raisul Islam Asad * Sara Zaker * Afsana Mimi * Abul Khair ==Soundtrack== The music of this film was directed by Syed Shabab Ali Arzoo. ==Awards== {|class="wikitable" !
